description: Enterprise techniques used by FIN10, ATT&CK group G0051 v1.0
name: FIN10 (G0051)

techniques.comment: [FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) uses PowerShell for execution as well as PowerShell Empire to establish persistence.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has executed malicious .bat files containing PowerShell commands.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has used batch scripts and scheduled tasks to delete critical system files.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has used Meterpreter to enumerate users on remote systems.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has established persistence by using the Registry option in PowerShell Empire to add a Run key.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has established persistence by using S4U tasks as well as the Scheduled Task option in PowerShell Empire.

[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has used stolen credentials to connect remotely to victim networks using VPNs protected with only a single factor. The group has also moved laterally using the Local Administrator account.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has used RDP to move laterally to systems in the victim environment.
[FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) has deployed Meterpreter stagers and SplinterRAT instances in the victim network after moving laterally.
